phrased.dictionary

Interface for looking up words of a type (referred to as the category) from a dictionary.

Dictionary defaultDictionary;
The default dictionary used by the macro system. Must be instantiated in user code.

interface Dictionary;
A dictionary is an object that can return words from certain categories.

abstract string lookup(string category);
The sole method of a Dictionary. Returns a single word from the given category.

If the category does not exist, or is empty, it is recommended to return a string of the form <error: unknown category "categoryName">, but not required.

class NullDictionary: phrased.dictionary.Dictionary;
A dictionary that returns error messages for any category of word that is looked up.

this();


string lookup(string category);
See Dictionary.lookup

class RuntimeDictionary: phrased.dictionary.Dictionary;
A basic dictionary that looks up words in memory, falling back to another dictionary if a requested category has not been populated.

Useful for variables that change between expression evaluations (such as the time, date, a person's name, etc.), or constructing a dictionary in code rather than from, say, a database or text file.

Dictionary fallback;
The dictionary that is used instead when an unknown category is looked up

this();
Construct with an instance of NullDictionary as the fallback.

this(Dictionary fallback);
Construct with a user-supplied dictionary as the fallback.

void clear(string category);
Clear a certain category of words.

void clear();
Clear all definitions.

string lookup(string category);
See Dictionary.lookup
